zone.line: Who 'gainst the proud Transgressors
Pleadest before God's love! Arrayed in Wisdom's mail
Lift thy lightning lance in mirth,
Nor let thy high heart fail
Though from thier hundred gates the leagued Oppressors
With hurrieed legions move!
Hail, Hail, All - Hail!
What, though Cimnerian Anarchs dare blaspheme
Freedom & thee? thy shieeld is as a mirror
To make thier blind slaves see, & with fierce gleam
To turn his hungry sword upon the wearer:
A new Actaeon's error
thier
Shall thisers have been - devoured by his own hounds.
Be Thou, like the imperial Bak Basilisk
Killing thy foe with unapparent wounds.
Gaze on Oppression, till at that dread risk
Aghast, she pass from the Earth's disk —
Fear not, but gaze - for freemen mightier grow
And slaves more feeble, gazing on thier foe
If Hope & Truth, & Justice can avail
Thou shalt be great. All Hail!
